result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David D Kelm appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for David D Kelm.   

Attorney Kryshak moves to amend the plea to an NGI plea. Court accepts the plea and orders an evaluation.  Attorney Kryshak states that the defendant will be going to DCI.  Attorney Kryshak will coordinate with Br 1 JA to draft the Order.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge

11:04 AM Defendant David D Kelm in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant David D Kelm in custody in the Waupaca County Jail.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David D Kelm appeared by video means with Attorney.
Deputy Valiquette is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a deputy with the Wood County Sheriffs department. Testifies to being dispatched to a stabbing. Testifies to meeting with the victim. Testifies to what the victim said happened. Testifies to the relationship between the defendant and the victim. Testifies to injuries that were found on the victim. Testifies to a 2 hour stand by. Testifies to the defendant being the only person in the home at the time. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to where the knives were found. Testifies to where blood was found. Testifies to what the victim stated happened to another officer w/ more details. Testifies to where the stab wounds were on the victim. 
Attorney Kryshak cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to the victim being found by a vehicle passing by. Testifies to 2 separate knives that were used and the type of knives. 
Attorney Lambert follows up with questions.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it.
Defendant requests substitution of judge.

Not guilty pleas are entered and bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
